episodes.title: Temple of Augustus and Rome in Ankara – Provincial Imperial Cults
episodes.description:
The Temple of Augustus and Rome located in Ankara is a classic example of a temple to the Imperial Cult. Beginning with Octavian after he assumed the title of Caesar Augustus, the imperial cult was designed to bring Roman values and customs to the far flung reaches of the Roman Empire. It also served as a symbol of power, a deterrent to insurrection, and litmus test of a subject’s loyalty to the divine emperor. In this video we will explore the role of the Imperial Cult during the Roman Empire.

IG: HistoryfortheTourist
